definition: to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: It was really a gas to find someone I could talk with.
sentences.chinese: 找到一個能和我談得來的人真是一件讓人高興的事。

sentences.english: I like to hang out with him because I feel like I can talk to him.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡和他在一起，因爲我們很談得來。

sentences.english: We got on so well in the last century.
sentences.chinese: 上個世紀，我們好像很談得來。

sentences.english: e.g I like to hang out with him because I feel like I can talk to him.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡和他在一起，因爲我們很談得來。

sentences.english: David is happy to meet a man who gets along well with him.
sentences.chinese: 大衛慶幸找到一個談得來的人。

sentences.english: Through the contact, it is nice to talk to two people, Mr Mr Decided to remarry.
sentences.chinese: 通過接觸，兩個人很談得來，劉老先生決定再婚。
